The Daytona Beach Area Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB) is committed to ensuring accessibility of its website to people with disabilities. The CVB is actively working to increase the accessibility and usability of the website. The CVB does not discriminate in its programs and services on the basis of religion, age, race, color, national origin, gender, marital or parental status, or disability and complies the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) of 1990. Due to the CVB’s integration with external vendors, some areas within the site remain beyond our control. To report an accessibility issue, request accessibility assistance regarding our website content, or to request a specific electronic format, please complete our
Accessibility Feedback Form
. We will make reasonable efforts to accommodate all needs.

Tourism Events Funding
The Daytona Beach area has a rich history with events; from our high-impact racing events and motorcycle rallies to arts and culture-focused festivals to televised sports events such as the Daytona International Speedway races as well as National Cheerleaders Association (NCA) Cheerleading Championships and various Central Florida Sports Commission supported activities.
This wide range of event offerings is unique to our area and creates a great opportunity to develop destination-based marketing programs uniquely geared toward specific interest groups. This targeted event marketing allows us to maximize overnight stays, while positioning the destination as a fun, active location for a wide range of consumers.
The Halifax Area Advertising Authority (HAAA) sets aside funds for the marketing of events that exhibit positive tourism potential. Funds designated for any events shall assist qualified applicants with event marketing and advertising initiatives that have the ability to show a direct effect on hotel/lodging occupancy during designated time frames, as well as create positive image-building publicity for the Daytona Beach area.
Festival and event producers interested in partnering with the Daytona Beach Area Convention and Visitors Bureau for the promotion of events occurring in the Daytona Beach area are invited to carefully review the current HAAA-approved Funding Guidelines and Application. Tourism Event Marketing Support Applications must be completed and returned in a timely manner to be considered.
NOTE: For any
competition
event funding request, please contact Brandon Little at
blittle@daytonabeach.com
or (386) 255-0415 Ext 138. or
download the application here.
Tourism Events Procedure Guidelines
Event Marketing Support Application
For more information please contact:
Brian Bentley
, PDM
Manager of Corporate Partnerships and Events
386.255.0415 ext. 140

Daytona Beach Events
Each year, events in Daytona Beach and the surrounding area bring visitors to the fun, sun, surf and one-of-a-kind experiences. The Daytona Beach area is a wonderful blend of the easy beach lifestyle and world-class
arts
and entertainment events. You'll never run out of things to do when visiting Daytona Beach with a wide range of events such as
Daytona Beach Bike Week
,
Speedweeks and the DAYTONA 500
,
Jeep Beach
, the
Coke Zero Sugar 400
, the
Daytona Turkey Run
, and
Biketoberfest​®
, there is something to do for everyone.
Submitting your Daytona Beach area tourism-related event is easy and free
!
**All event information is subject to change and restrictions apply. Please check with event organizers directly for the most up-to-date information and what guidelines to follow.**

About Us
The Halifax Area Advertising Authority (HAAA) is an 11-member board appointed by members of the Volusia County Council. HAAA is charged with promoting tourism offerings within the greater Daytona Beach area and does business as the Daytona Beach Area Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB).
The mission of the CVB is to contribute to and enhance the overall economic prosperity of the Halifax Taxing District and all of Volusia County through the successful promotion of the area as a preferred tourism destination. The CVB works with area lodging, attractions, restaurants and other tourism and hospitality-related businesses to represent the area to potential leisure and business travelers, tour operators, travel agents, meeting planners, and the travel media.
In Volusia County, these efforts are funded by the 3% Convention Development Tax (bed tax) which is paid by visitors (not residents) and is collected on overnight, short-term accommodations. The Halifax Taxing District, one of three such taxing districts in Volusia County, includes the cities and communities of Ormond By The Sea, Ormond Beach, Daytona Beach, Daytona Beach Shores, Wilber By The Sea, Ponce Inlet, Holly Hill and South Daytona.
The CVB offers a variety of services to help local tourism and hospitality industry partners reach potential visitors and successfully market their businesses. It also operates two Official Visitor Information Centers located at Daytona International Speedway and Teddy Morse's Daytona Harley-Davidson at Destination Daytona in Ormond Beach
.
Our Organization
Halifax Area Advertising Authority
Committees

Tourism Partner Resources
Tourism Events Funding
The Daytona Beach Area Convention and Visitors Bureau (CVB) is committed to ensuring the accessibility of its website to people with disabilities. The CVB is actively working to increase the accessibility and usability of the website. The CVB does not discriminate in its programs and services on the basis of religion, age, race, color, national origin, gender, marital or parental status, or disability and complies with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) of 1990. Due to the CVB’s integration with external vendors, some areas within the site remain beyond our control. To report an accessibility issue, request accessibility assistance regarding our website content, or to request a specific electronic format, please complete our
Accessibility Feedback Form
. We will make reasonable efforts to accommodate all needs.
Disclaimer:
The data on this site is solely provided to give information about the lodging and services offered by the properties and businesses in the Daytona Beach Area. Every reasonable effort was made to ensure that this information is correct at the moment of inclusion, which does not mean that this site may contain incomplete or inaccurate information or information that is not up to date.

Partner Gateway
Partner Resources
Submit an Event
You're one step closer to letting Daytona Beach area visitors know about your exciting event! Here are some helpful guidelines to follow when submitting a tourism-related event:
Only
Volusia County events may be submitted. The DaytonaBeach.com calendar helps promote a variety of events that encourage visitors to plan or extend their overnight stays in the destination:
family-friendly festivals and events, concerts, theater performances, sports and motorsports, car shows and rallies, and arts, culture and heritage exhibits
. Please fill out the fields below and click "Submit Event." Your listing will then go through an approval process to make sure it meets criteria and contains all the necessary information. Thank you for remembering DaytonaBeach.com for your event!
Best Practices:
Fill in the fields keeping these best practices in mind:
Select “All events” as well as all that apply in the
Event Category
field
Select “All Events” for your
Primary Category
Upload a jpeg image with the focal point of the image well centered. Try to avoid using a flyer with text as some will be cut off. You may add a flyer as an attachment.
Please limit your copy to three to four paragraphs including all the pertinent information regarding your event and write it in the third person in the
Event Description
.
If your event is only one day, select “One Day”, if not, select your recurrence or customize a series of dates in the
Event Start Date
field.

Daytona Beach Featured Events
Daytona Beach loves welcoming visitors to its sunny shoreline year-round. Put some of these events on your list and make the most of your next visit. Featured are amazing fine art festivals, classic car shows, the best specialty food festivals, premier racing at Daytona International Speedway and more!
The World’s Most Famous Beach is home to this line-up of annual events, making a visit fun for your family to look forward to year after year.  Visit the events calendar for the full schedule of upcoming events and festivals. Hope you can visit soon!
Add these popular Daytona Beach annual events to your travel itinerary.
**Event information is subject to change. Visitors are encouraged to check with event organizers directly for the most up-to-date information.**

Partner Resources
Sports Funding Application
The Daytona Beach Area CVB (DBACVB) Sports Sales division is under the Halifax Area Advertising Authority (HAAA) – The mission of HAAA is to contribute to and enhance the overall economic prosperity of the Halifax Area Taxing District and all of Volusia County through the successful promotion of the area as a preferred tourism destination.
The DBACVB recognizes sports as a major contributor to the overall tourism economy. In order to develop this business, the DBACVB has put in place an Event Funding Program. All requests for funds must receive the recommendation from the CVB Sports Advisory Committee and Halifax Area Advertising Authority Board of Directors. Once a sponsorship amount has been allocated, we will not disburse funds until after the event has been completed and a post-event economic impact report has been produced.
Application Deadline:
Funding applications will be reviewed on a quarterly basis unless alternate accommodations have been made. The amount of funding requested will be a factor in determining the length of this process.
Sports Event Funding Guidelines
Downloadable Sports Funding Application
* EVENTS THAT HAVE ALREADY BEEN CONTRACTED ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR FUNDING*
Reimbursement/Accountability
Within 30 days after the completion of the event, the organization must submit a Post Event Report, copy of collateral displaying the DBACVB logo, Invoice for grant funds (addressed to Halifax Area Advertising Authority), and a W-9 tax form. After a review of the Post Event Report, grant funds will be forwarded to the organization.
If the original award amount must be prorated due to major changes in the event, an updated invoice will be requested with the new award amount.
The DBACVB will conduct random audits to promote the accuracy of attendance and room nights reported in the Post Event Report.
Natural disasters and other incidents that may affect the impact generated by the event will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
All questions can be directed to: Brandon Little, Senior Sales Manager, Sports Business Development,
blittle@daytonabeach.com
, 386-255-0415 ext. 138
*Please be advised that completing an application does not guarantee funding.
Downloadable Sports Funding Application
Submitting this form means you certify that you have read and understood the Policies and Procedures and that the information included with the application is true and correct.

Daytona Beach Events
Often called home of the world’s most famous beaches, the Daytona Beach area continues to delight and surprise visitors with its diverse and growing array of attractions and events. The Daytona Beach area consists of several cities and towns including Ormond Beach, Daytona Beach, Daytona Beach Shores, Ponce Inlet, Holly Hill and South Daytona. Between the attractions, events and entertainment, festivals, arts and culture, and sports, there’s plenty of events in the Daytona Beach area to explore. The Calendar of Events lists many of those events – big and small – taking place in Daytona Beach and throughout Volusia County.
**EVENT INFORMATION IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE. VISITORS ARE ENCOURAGED TO CHECK WITH EVENT ORGANIZERS DIRECTLY FOR THE MOST UP-TO-DATE INFORMATION.**

About The Area
Make Daytona Beach your beach base camp and dive into all that East Central Florida has to offer.
The Daytona Beach area includes seven
cities and towns
– Ormond Beach, Daytona Beach, Daytona Beach Shores, Ponce Inlet, Holly Hill and South Daytona – and is known for its iconic
beaches
, and so much more.
Experience the rich
cultural tapestry
of this iconic destination. Embrace your sense of
outdoor adventure
. Pair your travels with the best in
local cuisine
. The waterfront views – along 23 miles of beaches, Halifax River and Ponce Inlet - are vast and relaxing. Eclectic historic downtowns and
shopping meccas
provide lively backdrops to while away your days. Go off the beaten path to explore some
local history
.
Visitors can choose to stay at a bountiful number of
accommodations
, including oceanfront resorts, seaside cottages or at any number of charming boutique hotels and bed and breakfasts. With over 200 properties and 12,000 rooms, it's easy to choose the ideal hotel, motel, vacation rental, condo or campground to suit your budget and style.
